Class JasmAssembler

java.lang.Object
edu.westminsteru.jasm.JasmAssembler
public class JasmAssembler extends Object
Assembler for jasm files. The usual process for using this class looks like
  1. Use the String or Reader overload of the static reading method to obtain an instance that reads from the given input.
  2. Call assemble() to attempt assembly of the input code. This method returns Status.Success or .Failure to signify success or failure of assembly.
  3. If assemble() failed, use getErrorMessages() to obtain a list of ErrorMessages describing the errors that occurred.
  4. Otherwise, the getAssembledBytecodes() returns Bytecode objects, each consisting of a class name and its assembled bytecode (as a byte[]). These bytes are suitable to be written to a .class file or given to a ClassLoader.

  • Method Details

    • reading

      public static JasmAssembler reading(Reader in)
      Creates a JasmAssembler that reads from the given Reader.
      Parameters:
      in - the reader to read code from
      Returns:
      a JasmAssembler

    • reading

      public static JasmAssembler reading(String input)
      Creates a JasmAssembler that reads code directly from a String.
      Parameters:
      input - the String to read code from
      Returns:
      a JasmAssembler

    • assemble

      public Status assemble()
      Attempts to assemble the code obtained from whatever input source was given when the JasmAssembler was created. This method should be called only once.
      Returns:
      Status.Success if assembly succeeded, or Status.Failure if there was an error in the code

    • getAssembledBytecodes

      public List<Bytecode> getAssembledBytecodes()
      Returns the bytecodes resulting from a previous successful call to assemble().
      Returns:
      a list of the bytecodes
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if this method is called before assemble(), or if assemble() returned Status.Failure

    • getErrorMessages

      public List<ErrorMessage> getErrorMessages()
      Returns the error messages resulting from a previous unsuccessful call to assemble().
      Returns:
      a list of error messages (empty if there were no error messages)
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this method is called before assemble()
